itemscroller.config.generic.comment.carp:
Set to true if the server is running the Carpet mod,
and has the ctrlQCrafting option enabled.
This just changes which method Item Scroller uses
for the Drop key + Shift + Right click crafting.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.clie:
Enable updating the crafting recipe output directly on the client side.
This fixes the quick/mass crafting and right-click-to-craft-a-stack
features otherwise being broken in 1.12.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.craf:
If enabled, then the recipe items are also rendered
in the crafting recipe view.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.debu: Enables some debug messages in the game console
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.modM: Can disable all the functionality of the entire mod
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.mass:
Prevent recipe output slot updates in the middle of moving items
to the crafting grid. This should reduce CPU usage
because of not constantly querying the recipe after every grid change.
The interval in game ticks the massCraft operation is repeated at

How many massCraft iterations/attempts to do per execution.
With unstackable items or a full inventory and "small recipe"
this will need to be larger, as a shift + click craft to the inventory
might only craft 1 or 2 items per operation.

Uses a newer method of filling the crafting grid,
using only swap slot packets.

Note: Due to only using slot swap packets,
no partial crafts are possible! And also no
stack splitting will happen, at all.

Uses the "Recipe Book Protocol" inspired by Andrew54757's "Craft-Fix" fork,
but re-implemented in a way that works for 1.21+.
§6NOTE: This is NOT compatible with "rateLimitClickPackets" enabled.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.pack:
The limit of sent emulated slot click packets per game tick,
if 'rateLimitClickPackets' is enabled
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.craf:
If enabled, then the crafting features recipes are saved to a file
inside minecraft/itemscroller/recipes_worldorservername.nbt.
This makes the recipes persistent across game restarts.

If true, then the recipe file is global, instead
 of being saved per-world or server
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.rate:
This is meant for compatibility with Spigot servers and similar,
which apply rate limits to packets from the client.
This queues up the emulated slot click packets and sends
them rate limited over time. The limit per game tick can be set in 'packetRateLimit´.
§6NOTE: This is NOT compatible with "massCraftUseRecipeBook" enabled.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.reve: Reverse the scrolling direction for single item mode.
Reverse the scrolling direction for full stacks mode.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.useR:
Enables caching the last used recipe in the crafting
recipe output item fetching code. This can help a lot
with lowering CPU usage when mass crafting stuff.
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.useS:
When enabled, the item movement direction depends
on the slots' y-position on screen. Might be derpy with more
complex inventories, use with caution!
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.vill:
Whether or not global (per-item-type) villager trade
favorites should be used.

Remember and restore the last scroll position in the
trade list when re-opening the GUI
itemscroller.config.generic.comment.sort:
Enables the Quick Inventory Sorting feature.
This is activated by hovering over any item,
and then pressing the bound §a"sortInventory"§r key bind.

Assume that empty shulker boxes can
stack when sorting the inventory.
This is useful if you installed mods
to allow shulker boxes to stack.
This will send an extra packet to ensure the
inventory is synced.

Sort shulker boxes at the end of the inventory
when sorting the inventory.

Sort shulker boxes so that the most-empty
boxes are first, and the full boxes are last.

Sort bundles at the end of the inventory
when sorting the inventory.

Sort bundles so that the most-empty
bundles are first, and the full bundles are last.

These items will have a priority to be sorted first.
You can put item IDs (eg. "minecraft:diamond_sword") or custom names (eg. "Wither killer").
If you put custom names, those will be preferred before the id.
Items in the list will be sorted to the front according to the list.

These items will have a priority to be sorted last.
You can put item IDs (eg. "minecraft:diamond_sword") or custom names (eg. "Wither killer").
If you put custom names, those will be preferred before the id.
Items in the list will be sorted to the back according to the list.

The default sorting method used to compare items.

§6Category [ANY]§r = Sort by §a"sortCategoryOrder"§r first, and then followed by:
§6Item Name§r - Sort by Items' Name
§6Item Count§r - Sort by Item's Stack Size, then by RawID
§6Item Rarity§r - Sort by Rarity, then by RawID
§6Item RawID§r - Sort by RawID
§d(RawID is the built-in Vanilla Item Index value)§r

§cData Components are compared by Hash Code afterwards, and then
§cby Item Stack Size after all other checks have passed.§r

The Category order to be used for sorting items.
The Vanilla Creative Menu Categories are used.
itemscroller.config.toggles.comment.enab:
Enables scrolling items to and from crafting grids,
with a built-in 18 recipe memory.
Hold down the Recipe key to see the stored recipes and
to change the selection. While holding the Recipe key,
you can either scroll or press a number key to change the selection.
A recipe is stored to the currently selected "recipe slot"
 by clicking pick block over a configured crafting output slot.
The supported crafting grids must be added to the scrollableCraftingGrids list.

Enables dropping all matching items from the same
inventory with the hotkey

Enables crafting up to one full stack when right clicking on
a slot that has been configured as a crafting output slot.

Enables scroll moving all items at once while
holding the modifierMoveEverything keybind

Enables scroll moving all matching stacks at once
while holding the modifierMoveMatching keybind
Enables moving items one item at a time by scrolling over a stack
Enables moving entire stacks at a time by scrolling over a stack

Enables a "fallback" mode for scrolling entire stacks
(for example to a vanilla crafting table,
where shift + click doesn't work).

Enables special handling for the Villager GUIs.
(Normally you can't shift click items in them.)
Hold shift and scroll up/down over the trade output slot.

Enables dropping all matching items at once by holding
shift while clicking to drop a stack

Enables moving all matching stacks at once by holding
shift while placing items to an empty slot

Enable trade favoriting and quick trade features for villagers.
Note: The Shift + scrolling over the output slot is a separate feature
and not affected by this option.
This option enables middle clicking to mark favorite trades,
and right clicking on the trade list to fully trade that one trade.
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.craf: Craft everything possible once with the currently selected recipe
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.drop: Drop all stacks identical to the hovered stack
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.mass:
Mass craft and throw out the results with the
currently selected recipe as long as this
keybind is held down
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.move:
Move all of the currently selected recipe's
output items from the player inventory
to the other inventory
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.reci: Show the Item Scroller recipe GUI
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.slot: Print debug info for the hovered slot or GUI
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.stor: Store a recipe while hovering over a crafting output item
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.thro:
Throw all of the currently selected recipe's
output items to the ground from the player inventory
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.vill:
Trade everything possible with all the favorited trades
of the current villager
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.keyD: Key to drop all but the last item from each stack dragged over
Key to drop one item from each stack dragged over
Key to drop the entire stacks dragged over

Key to move all but the last item from
all the stacks dragged over
Key to move all matching items dragged over
Key to move one item from each stack dragged over
Key to move the entire stacks dragged over
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.keyM:
Key to move ALL items to the other
inventory when clicking a stack
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.wsMo:
The key to move all but the last item from each stack
"down" in the inventor
The key to move all matching items "down" in the inventory
The key to move single items "down" in the inventory
The key to move stacks "down" in the inventory

The key to move all but the last item from each stack
"up" in the inventory
The key to move all matching items "up" in the inventory
The key to move single items "up" in the inventory
The key to move stacks "up" in the inventory
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.modi:
Modifier key to move ALL items to the other
inventory when scrolling over a stack

Modifier key to move all matching items to the other
inventory when scrolling over a stack

Modifier key to move the entire stack to the other
inventory when scrolling over it

Modifier key to hold while middle clicking a trade,
to toggle the global favorite state for that trade.
Global favorites are used for villagers that don't
have any "local"/villager-specific favorites set.
itemscroller.config.hotkeys.comment.sort: Sort the inventory that the cursor is hovering over
